once_all_parameters_have_been_chosen_cli: Once all parameters have been chosen, click SEARCH. Search results will appear in the footer area of the Vertex window, and on the map.
note_the_number_of_files_that_are_predic: Note: The number of files that are predicted to match the current search parameters is displayed under the SEARCH button. If there are no predicted matches, the search button will be greyed out and display NO RESULTS.
selecting_list_from_the_search_type_drop: Selecting 'List' from the Search Type dropdown menu, opens the Scene List Search window and allows you to enter a list of scene or file names.
a_list_type_of_scene_allows_searching_fo: A list type of 'Scene' allows searching for specific scene names (granule names), and the results will include any files that are part of those scenes.
the_file_list_type_allows_searching_for_: The 'File' list type allows searching for specific file names (product names), and the results will only include exactly those files.
clicking_edit_list_opens_the_scene_list_: Clicking 'Edit List' opens the Scene List Search window so you can make changes to your list.

click_on_the_zoom_icon_next_to_a_scene_n: Click on the zoom icon next to a scene name to zoom-in to the scene’s location on the map.

the_baseline_tool_button_opens_the_asf_b: The 'Baseline Tool' button opens the ASF Baseline Tool, which is used for the creation of InSAR stacks.

the_files_column_right_displays_a_list_o: The Files column (right) displays a list of files available for the currently selected scene.
you_may_download_files_immediately_or_ad: You may download files immediately or add them to your download queue by clicking on the appropriate icon.
quickly_learn_the_basics_of_vertex_data_: Quickly learn the basics of Vertex Data Search with this getting started series.
expand_your_skills_with_our_full_list_of: Expand your skills with our full list of Vertex Data Search tutorials.
some_dataset_results_contain_bundled_and: Some dataset results contain bundled and compressed, or zipped, files. Vertex allows for the contents
